markdown:
Skip to main content

![partsperson parts technician](/sites/default/files/2023-01/partsperson_web.jpg)

As a Parts Technician, you’re an organized person well-suited to overseeing the complex systems that ensure businesses properly order, track and store the various parts and supplies they need.

You’re a team player who works with retail service staff, sales staff and service technicians, who rely on your expertise to ensure they can properly manage the supply of parts and materials.

#### What You'll Learn

  * How to follow proper health and safety requirements
  * How to communicate effectively
  * How to identify parts
  * How to merchandise parts
  * How to use equipment and procedures to handle materials 



#### Key Job Skills

  * Communication
  * Coordination
  * Parts identification and cataloguing
  * Health and safety procedures
  * Materials handling techniques and equipment



#### Technical Training

To get certified, you will need to sign up for technical training at an approved training provider in addition to on-the-job training. 

Visit [Trades Training BC](https://www.tradestrainingbc.ca/) and [EducationPlannerBC](https://educationplannerbc.ca/search) for a comprehensive list of what programs are available in your trade at public and non-public schools. 

Technical Training 3 weeks over 1 year 

Work-Based Training

1770 HOURS

General Skills

[Analytical](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAnalytical) [Coordinated](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ACoordinated) [Resourceful](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AResourceful) [Systematic](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ASystematic)

For more information regarding the other levels in this progressive trade, please refer to the following program pages:

  * [_Parts Technician 1_](/parts-technician-1)

  * [_Parts Technician 2_](/parts-technician-2)




Program Updates

  * **June 2023:**[_Program Update_](/media/2018/download) (Harmonization Implementation)

  * **November 2022:** A new Program Outline and Program Profile will be implemented on **August 1, 2023**. Please see [_OPSN 2022 026_](/media/185/download) for details.

  * [_OPSN Archives_](/program-standards-updates)




## 

Harmonized Program Information and Resources

In effect starting August 1, 2023

#### [Program Profile Occupational Description A "Parts Technician" is involved in ordering, warehousing, maintaining inventory control and sales of parts. They are responsible for identifying parts and equipment, searching for parts, shipping and receiving parts, providing customer service and advice, and maintaining records.  A Parts Technician works in various industries such as automotive service, commercial transport, heavy duty equipment, small engine repair, aeronautics, agricultural equipment, marine equipment, the mining sector, and the forestry sector. The work environment for Parts Technicians is generally indoors in a warehouse and/or at a service counter. Some parts people may perform deliveries of parts to their customers. Parts Technicians generally work in teams that include retail service staff, sales staff, and service technicians. View Program Profile](/media/667/download)

#### [Program Outline Guidelines for delivery of technical training at SkilledTradesBC Recognized Training Providers View PDF](/media/666/download) #### [Record Book An easy-to-use tool to help you identify your trades training needs, track your progress, and move towards certification.  View PDF](/media/2444/download)

## 

Challenge the Trade

If you have significant work experience in a trade but have never been certified in Canada, you may apply to challenge the certification. Learn more about [How to Challenge a Skilled Trade](/challenge-skilled-trade).

OR

If you sponsor apprentices but have never been certified in Canada, you may request to supervise and sign-off apprentices when they are ready to be certified. Please [contact customer service](/contact-us) for more information.

#### [Instructions How to Apply View](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/instructions-challenge-certification) #### [Online Application Sign up for the Portal to start your online application View PDF](https://portal.skilledtradesbc.ca/Account/Login/Register?registrationType=certified) #### [Employer Declaration Document of relevant work experience View PDF](/media/2624/download) #### [Statutory Declaration Attestation for self-employment/work experience when employer cannot be contacted View PDF](/media/2623/download)
